Package com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow

Class SensitiveDataHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qore.jni.QoreObjectWrapper
      • com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.SensitiveDataHelper
  • public class SensitiveDataHelper
extends org.qore.jni.QoreObjectWrapper
    Java wrapper for the OMQ::UserApi::Workflow::SensitiveDataHelper "SensitiveDataHelper" class in Qorus This class is a helper class that allows sensitive_data "workflow sensitive data" to be read and updated atomically; the write lock for the data is grabbed in the constructor and released in the destructor Calls to the following workflow API functions related to sensitive_data "sensitive data" can be made normally while this object exists and the write lock is held; the functions are aware of and automatically use the write lock held by this object:
    • WorkflowApi.deleteSensitiveDataKey()
    • WorkflowApi.getSensitiveData()
    • WorkflowApi.updateSensitiveData()
    The %Qore-language destructor is run at the end of the Java step execution, after the step returns to Qorus.
    See Also:
    sensitive_data

      • get

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> get​(java.lang.String skey,
                                                                      java.lang.String svalue,
                                                                      java.lang.String... keys)
                                                               throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the value of multiple keys in the sensitive_data "sensitive data hash" for the given key value Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    // get the tax number and address for the person
    HashMap<String, Object> hm = sdh.get("personal_id", personal_id, "tax_number", "address_city");
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        skey - the type of value provided in svalue
        svalue - the value of the sensitive data key identified by skey
        keys - multiple string key fields to return
        Returns:
        a hash of the requested keys
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        this method is equivalent to WorkflowApi.getSensitiveData()

    sdh.release();

      • getFromAlias

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getFromAlias​(java.lang.String alias,
                                                                               java.lang.String... keys)
                                                                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the value of multiple keys in the sensitive_data "sensitive data hash" for the given alias Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    // get the tax number and address for the person
    HashMap<String, Object> hm = sdh.getFromAlias(alias, "tax_number", "address_city");
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias to lookup; if the alias is unknown, an "INVALID-ALIAS" exception is raised
        keys - multiple string key fields to return
        Returns:
        a hash of the requested keys
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - INVALID-ALIAS thrown for invalid aliases
        Note:
        this method is equivalent to WorkflowApi.getSensitiveData()

      • getMetadata

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getMetadata​(java.lang.String skey,
                                                                              java.lang.String svalue)
                                                                       throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the sensitive metadata hash for the given sensitive data key and value if present, otherwise returns an empty hash Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    // get the metadata for the person
    HashMap<String, Object> metadata = sdh.getMetadata("personal_id", personal_id);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        skey - the type of sensitive key provided in svalue
        svalue - the value of the sensitive data key identified by skey
        Returns:
        the sensitive metadata hash stored according to the sensitive data key and value; if no such sensitive key and value exist for the order, or no metadata is present for the given sensitive key and value, then an empty hash is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        sensitive_data, wf_get_sensitive_metadata()
        Note:
        • returns sensitive data; take care not to log any of the data returned by this function
        • equivalent to WorkflowApi.getSensitiveMetadata()

      • getMetadataFromAlias

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getMetadataFromAlias​(java.lang.String alias)
                                                                                throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the sensitive metadata hash for the given sensitive data alias Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    // get the metadata for the person
    HashMap<String, Object> metadata = sdh.getMetadata("personal_id", personal_id);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias to lookup; if the alias is unknown, an "INVALID-ALIAS" exception is raised
        Returns:
        the sensitive metadata hash stored according to the sensitive data alias
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - INVALID-ALIAS thrown for invalid aliases
        See Also:
        sensitive_data, wf_get_sensitive_metadata_from_alias()
        Note:
        • returns sensitive data; take care not to log any of the data returned by this function
        • equivalent to WorkflowApi.getSensitiveMetadataFromAlias()

      • getAliases

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getAliases()
                                                                      throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash of all sensitive data aliases for the current order or an empty hash if there are none Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    // get the aliases for sensitive data for this order
    HashMap<String, Object> ah = sdh.getAliases();
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Returns:
        a hash of all sensitive data aliases for the current order or an empty hash if there are none, otherwise keys are alias names and values are hashes with the following keys:
        • skey: (string_type "string") the sensitive data key type
        • svalue: (string_type "string") the sensitive data value (considered sensitive itself)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        • returns sensitive data; take care not to log any of the sensitive data returned by this function
        • this method is equivalent to WorkflowApi.getSensitiveDataAliases()

      • getKeyValues

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getKeyValues()
                                                                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        Returns a hash of sensitive data keys and values saved against the order; the sensitive data hashes themselves are not returned, just the information used to index sensitive data against the order Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    HashMap<String, Object> h = sdh.getKeyValues();
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Returns:
        a hash of sensitive data keys and values saved against the order; the sensitive data hashes themselves are not returned, just the information used to index sensitive data against the order; if no sensitive data is stored against the order, an empty hash is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        sensitive_data
        Note:
        returns sensitive data; sensitive data values should not be logged

      • replace

        public void replace​(java.lang.String skey,
                    java.lang.String svalue,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> new_data,
                    java.lang.String[] aliases,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> meta)
             throws java.lang.Throwable
        Replaces sensitive_data "sensitive data" for the sensitive key value given; the data has already been committed to the database when the method returns Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    // replace sensitive data for the person
    sdh.replace("personal_id", h.personal_id, replacement_hash);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        skey - the type of value provided in svalue; must not be longer than 100 bytes long or a "SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR" exception is raised
        svalue - the value of the sensitive data key identified by skey; if this string is empty or longer than 100 bytes, a "SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR" exception is raised
        new_data - the data to use to replace the sensitive data hash for the given sensitive data key and value
        aliases - zero or more aliases for the sensitive key value given
        meta - optional sensitve data metadata with the following recommended keys:
        • PURPOSE: free-form information about the purpose of the sensitive data
        • CATEGORIES: free-form information about the categories of sensitive data
        • RECIPIENTS: free-form information about the recipients or recipient catories of sensitive data
        • STORAGE: free-form information about the storage time or rules for sensitive data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR no sensitive key value was provided; sensitive key or alias value too long (100 bytes maximum length in the encoding used by the system schema)
        Note:
        • there is currently no function equivalent to this method for sensitive_data "sensitive dynamic data"; this method replaces all the sensitive data for the given sensitive key and value
        • the metadata keys listed above are recommended for consistency's sake but are not checked; a hash with any keys can be stored with this API
        • the use of this method causes SQL I/O to be performed in the system schema; to maximize performance, calls to this and other similar methods should be minimized if possible
        • this method only replaces sensitive data for a single sensitive data key and value, for a method that replaces sensitive data for multiple sensitive data keys and values in a single transaction, see replaceMulti()
        • use replaceMulti() when replacing sensitive data for more than one key and value at a time as it is more efficient from a database transaction I/O point of view

      • replace

        public void replace​(java.lang.String skey,
                    java.lang.String svalue,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> new_data,
                    java.lang.String[] aliases)
             throws java.lang.Throwable
        Replaces sensitive_data "sensitive data" for the sensitive key value given; the data has already been committed to the database when the method returns Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    // replace sensitive data for the person
    sdh.replace("personal_id", h.personal_id, replacement_hash);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        skey - the type of value provided in svalue; must not be longer than 100 bytes long or a "SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR" exception is raised
        svalue - the value of the sensitive data key identified by skey; if this string is empty or longer than 100 bytes, a "SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR" exception is raised
        new_data - the data to use to replace the sensitive data hash for the given sensitive data key and value
        aliases - zero or more aliases for the sensitive key value given
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR no sensitive key value was provided; sensitive key or alias value too long (100 bytes maximum length in the encoding used by the system schema)
        Note:
        • there is currently no function equivalent to this method for sensitive_data "sensitive dynamic data"; this method replaces all the sensitive data for the given sensitive key and value
        • the metadata keys listed above are recommended for consistency's sake but are not checked; a hash with any keys can be stored with this API
        • the use of this method causes SQL I/O to be performed in the system schema; to maximize performance, calls to this and other similar methods should be minimized if possible
        • this method only replaces sensitive data for a single sensitive data key and value, for a method that replaces sensitive data for multiple sensitive data keys and values in a single transaction, see replaceMulti()
        • use replaceMulti() when replacing sensitive data for more than one key and value at a time as it is more efficient from a database transaction I/O point of view

      • replace

        public void replace​(java.lang.String skey,
                    java.lang.String svalue,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> new_data)
             throws java.lang.Throwable
        Replaces sensitive_data "sensitive data" for the sensitive key value given; the data has already been committed to the database when the method returns Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    // replace sensitive data for the person
    sdh.replace("personal_id", h.personal_id, replacement_hash);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        skey - the type of value provided in svalue; must not be longer than 100 bytes long or a "SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR" exception is raised
        svalue - the value of the sensitive data key identified by skey; if this string is empty or longer than 100 bytes, a "SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR" exception is raised
        new_data - the data to use to replace the sensitive data hash for the given sensitive data key and value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR no sensitive key value was provided; sensitive key or alias value too long (100 bytes maximum length in the encoding used by the system schema)
        Note:
        • there is currently no function equivalent to this method for sensitive_data "sensitive dynamic data"; this method replaces all the sensitive data for the given sensitive key and value
        • the metadata keys listed above are recommended for consistency's sake but are not checked; a hash with any keys can be stored with this API
        • the use of this method causes SQL I/O to be performed in the system schema; to maximize performance, calls to this and other similar methods should be minimized if possible
        • this method only replaces sensitive data for a single sensitive data key and value, for a method that replaces sensitive data for multiple sensitive data keys and values in a single transaction, see replaceMulti()
        • use replaceMulti() when replacing sensitive data for more than one key and value at a time as it is more efficient from a database transaction I/O point of view

      • replaceMulti

        public void replaceMulti​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> sinfo)
                  throws java.lang.Throwable
        Replaces sensitive_data "sensitive data" for one more more sensitive key values given; the data has already been committed to the database when the method returns Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    // replace sensitive data for a single person
    HashMap<String, Object><String, Object> pinfo = new HashMap<String, Object><String, Object>() {
        {
            put("data", new_sensitive_data_hash);
        }
    };
    // set up a hash keyed by sensitive data value
    HashMap<String, Object><String, Object> sdinfo = new HashMap<String, Object><String, Object>() {
        {
            put(personal_id, pinfo);
        }
    };
    // set up a hash keyed by the sensitive data key name
    HashMap<String, Object><String, Object> sinfo = new HashMap<String, Object><String, Object> () {
        {
            put("personal_id", sdinfo);
        }
    };
    sdh.replaceMulti(sinfo);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        sinfo - a hash keyed by sensitive data key, where each value is a hash keyed by sensitive data value, where each value of that hash is a OMQ::SensitiveDataInfo "SensitiveDataInfo" hash giving the sensitive information for the given sensitive data key and value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR no sensitive key value was provided; sensitive key or alias value too long (100 bytes maximum length in the encoding used by the system schema)
        Since:
        Qorus 3.1.1.p1
        Note:
        • there is currently no function equivalent to this method for sensitive_data "sensitive dynamic data"; this method replaces all the sensitive data for the given sensitive keys and values
        • metadata keys are not checked; a hash with any metadata keys can be stored with this API
        • the use of this method causes SQL I/O to be performed in the system schema; to maximize performance, calls io this and other similar methods should be minimized if possible
        • this method replaces sensitive data for multiple sensitive data keys and values in a single transaction and therefore is preferred when updating multiple sensitive data elements over replace()

      • replaceFromAlias

        public void replaceFromAlias​(java.lang.String alias,
                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> new_data,
                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> meta)
                      throws java.lang.Throwable
        Replaces sensitive_data "sensitive data" for the sensitive alias given; the data has already been committed to the database when the method returns Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    sdh.replaceWithAlias(alias, new_sensitive_data);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        alias - the sensitive data alias; must be an existing alias or an "INVALID-ALIAS" exception is raised
        new_data - the data to use to replace the sensitive data hash for the given sensitive data alias
        meta - optional sensitve data metadata with the following recommended keys:
        • PURPOSE: free-form information about the purpose of the sensitive data
        • CATEGORIES: free-form information about the categories of sensitive data
        • RECIPIENTS: free-form information about the recipients or recipient catories of sensitive data
        • STORAGE: free-form information about the storage time or rules for sensitive data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - INVALID-ALIAS the given alias is unknown
        Note:
        • there is currently no function equivalent to this method for sensitive_data "sensitive dynamic data"; this method replaces all the sensitive data for the given sensitive key and value
        • the metadata keys listed above are recommended for consistency's sake but are not checked; a hash with any keys can be stored with this API
        • the use of this method causes SQL I/O to be performed in the system schema; to maximize performance, calls to this and other similar methods should be minimized if possible

      • replaceFromAlias

        public void replaceFromAlias​(java.lang.String alias,
                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> new_data)
                      throws java.lang.Throwable
        Replaces sensitive_data "sensitive data" for the sensitive alias given; the data has already been committed to the database when the method returns Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    sdh.replaceWithAlias(alias, new_sensitive_data);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        alias - the sensitive data alias; must be an existing alias or an "INVALID-ALIAS" exception is raised
        new_data - the data to use to replace the sensitive data hash for the given sensitive data alias
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - INVALID-ALIAS the given alias is unknown
        Note:
        • there is currently no function equivalent to this method for sensitive_data "sensitive dynamic data"; this method replaces all the sensitive data for the given sensitive key and value
        • the metadata keys listed above are recommended for consistency's sake but are not checked; a hash with any keys can be stored with this API
        • the use of this method causes SQL I/O to be performed in the system schema; to maximize performance, calls to this and other similar methods should be minimized if possible

      • replaceFromAlias

      • update

        public void update​(java.lang.String skey,
                   java.lang.String svalue,
                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> new_data,
                   java.lang.String[] aliases,
                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> meta)
            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Updates or creates the values of one or more keys in the workflow order's sensitive data hash for the given sensitive data key and value; the data has already been committed to the database when the method returns Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    sdh.update("personal_id", h.person.personal_id, h);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        skey - the type of value provided in svalue; must not be longer than 100 bytes long or a "SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR" exception is raised
        svalue - the value of the sensitive data key identified by skey; if this string is empty or longer than 100 bytes, a "SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR" exception is raised
        new_data - the data to create or update against skey; existing keys will be replaced; new keys will be added; if the new hash does not refer to existing keys, then those existing keys remain untouched
        aliases - zero or more string aliases for the sensitive key and value given
        meta - optional sensitve data metadata with the following recommended keys:
        • PURPOSE: free-form information about the purpose of the sensitive data
        • CATEGORIES: free-form information about the categories of sensitive data
        • RECIPIENTS: free-form information about the recipients or recipient categories of sensitive data
        • STORAGE: free-form information about the storage time or rules for sensitive data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR no sensitive key value was provided; sensitive key or alias value too long (100 bytes maximum length in the encoding used by the system schema)
        See Also:
        sensitive_data
        Note:
        • do not use sensitive data for the sensitive key names itself (skey) or alias(es) (aliases); key names and aliases may be logged to provide an audit trail of changes to sensitive data
        • metadata keys listed above for the meta argument are recommended for consistency's sake but are not checked; a hash with any keys can be stored with this API
        • the use of this method causes SQL I/O to be performed in the system schema; to maximize performance, calls to this and other similar methods should be minimized if possible

      • update

        svalue - the value of the sensitive data key identified by skey; if this string is empty or longer than 100 bytes, a "SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR" exception is raised
        new_data - the data to create or update against skey; existing keys will be replaced; new keys will be added; if the new hash does not refer to existing keys, then those existing keys remain untouched
        aliases - zero or more string aliases for the sensitive key and value given
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - SENSITIVE-DATA-ERROR no sensitive key value was provided; sensitive key or alias value too long (100 bytes maximum length in the encoding used by the system schema)

      • updateFromAlias

        public void updateFromAlias​(java.lang.String alias,
                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> new_data,
                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> meta)
                     throws java.lang.Throwable
        Updates or creates the values of one or more keys in the workflow order's sensitive data hash for the given sensitive data alias; the data has already been committed to the database when the method returns Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    sdh.updateFromAlias(alias, h);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:

        new_data - the data to create or update against skey; existing keys will be replaced; new keys will be added; if the new hash does not refer to existing keys, then those existing keys remain untouched
        meta - optional sensitve data metadata with the following recommended keys:

      • deleteKey

        public void deleteKey​(java.lang.String skey,
                      java.lang.String svalue,
                      java.lang.String... keys)
               throws java.lang.Throwable
        Deletes one or more keys from the workflow order data instanceâ€™s sensitive data hash for the given sensitive data key and value; the changes have already been committed to the database when the method returns Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    // delete the "tax_number" and "insurance_number" keys from the sensitive data hash for the given person
    sdh.deleteKey("personal_id", personal_id, "tax_number", "insurance_number");
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        skey - the type of sensitive key provided in svalue
        svalue - the value of the sensitive data key identified by skey
        keys - a single key or a list of keys to delete in the workflow order's sensitive data hash for the given sensitive key-value pair
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        sensitive_data
        Note:
        • equivalent to WorkflowApi.deleteSensitiveDataKey()
        • the use of this method causes SQL I/O to be performed in the system schema; to maximize performance, calls to this and other similar methods should be minimized if possible

      • del

        public boolean del​(java.lang.String skey,
                   java.lang.String svalue)
            throws java.lang.Throwable
        Deletes the sensitive data hash for the given sensitive data key and value; the changes have already been committed to the database when the method returns Example: 
        
SensitiveDataHelper sdh = new SensitiveDataHelper();
try {
    sdh.del("personal_id", personal_id);
} finally {
    sdh.release();
}
        Parameters:
        skey - the type of sensitive key provided in svalue
        svalue - the value of the sensitive data key identified by skey
        Returns:
        true if the data existed and was deleted, false if no such sensitive data key and value were present in the order
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        See Also:
        sensitive_data
        Note:
        • equivalent to WorkflowApi.deleteSensitiveData()
        • the use of this method causes SQL I/O to be performed in the system schema; to maximize performance, calls to this and other similar methods should be minimized if possible
